018package org.tquadrat.foundation.util;
019
020import static java.lang.String.format;
021import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.DEPRECATED;
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.UTF8;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.IOUtils.determineCheckSum;
027
028import java.io.File;
029import java.io.IOException;
030import java.math.BigInteger;
031import java.security.MessageDigest;
032import java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException;
033import java.util.HexFormat;
034import java.util.Locale;
035
036import org.apiguardian.api.API;
037import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
038import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.UtilityClass;
039import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.ImpossibleExceptionError;
040import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError;
041
042/**
043 *  This class provides some utility functions that are helpful in the
044 *  security arena. <br>
045 *  <br>The methods are thread safe, but they use a global message digest. As
046 *  a consequence, multiple threads that are calculating hashes will serialise
047 *  on the use of those digest. That is acceptable for an application where
048 *  this calculation does not occur that often (for example a web application
049 *  that needs to check a password at login) but not for an application that
050 *  uses multiple threads to calculate the hashes for a bunch of files.
051 *
052 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
053 *  @version $Id: SecurityUtils.java 1021 2022-03-01 22:53:02Z tquadrat $
054 *  @since 0.0.5
055 *
056 *  @UMLGraph.link
057 */
058@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: SecurityUtils.java 1021 2022-03-01 22:53:02Z tquadrat $" )
059@UtilityClass
060public final class SecurityUtils
061{
062        /*-----------*\
063    ====** Constants **========================================================
064        \*-----------*/
065    /**
066     *  A recommended prime for the Diffie-Hellman-Merkle key exchange scheme.
067     *
068     *  @see #calculateDiffieHellmanEncryptionKey(BigInteger,BigInteger,BigInteger)
069     *  @see #calculateDiffieHellmanPublicValue(BigInteger,BigInteger,BigInteger)
070     *  @see <a href="http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2412#page-45">http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2412#page-45</a>
071     */
072    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
073    public static final BigInteger DHM_PRIME = new BigInteger
074    (
075        """
076        2410312426921032588552076022197566074856950548502459942654116941958\
077        1088316826122288900938582613416146732271414779040121965036489570505\
078        8263194273070680500922306273474534107340669624601458936165977404102\
079        7169249453200378729434170325843778659198143763193776859869524088940\
080        1955773461198435453015470437472077499697637500843089263392955599688\
081        8245787241299381012913029459299994792636526405928464720973038494721\
082        1681434464714438488520940127459844288859336526896320919633919""" );
083
084    /**
085     *  A recommended prime modulus (primitive root) for the
086     *  Diffie-Hellman-Merkle key exchange scheme.
087     *
088     *  @see #calculateDiffieHellmanEncryptionKey(BigInteger,BigInteger,BigInteger)
089     *  @see #calculateDiffieHellmanPublicValue(BigInteger,BigInteger,BigInteger)
090     *  @see <a href="http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2412#page-45">http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2412#page-45</a>
091     */
092    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
093    public static final BigInteger DHM_PRIME_MOD = BigInteger.valueOf( 21 );
094
095    /**
096     *  The message that indicates that the named algorithm is not supported:
097     *  {@value}.
098     */
099    private static final String MSG_AlgorithmNotSupported = "MessageDigest does not support '%1$s' Algorithm";
100
101    /**
102     *  The length for an MD5 hash: {@value}.
103     */
104    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
105    public static final int MD5HASH_Length = 32;
106
107    /**
108     *  The length for an SHA1 hash: {@value}.
109     *
110     *  @deprecated Use
111     *  {@link #SHA1HASH_Length}
112     *  instead.
113     */
114    @Deprecated( since = "0.0.8", forRemoval = true )
115    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.8" )
116    public static final int SHAHASH_Length = 40;
117
118    /**
119     *  The length for an SHA1 hash: {@value}.
120     */
121    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.8" )
122    public static final int SHA1HASH_Length = 40;
123
124    /**
125     *  The length for an SHA256 hash: {@value}.
126     */
127    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.8" )
128    public static final int SHA256HASH_Length = 64;
129
130        /*------------------------*\
131    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
132        \*------------------------*/
133    /**
134     *  The message digest that is used to encrypt the passwords with the MD5
135     *  hash algorithm.
136     */
137    private static final MessageDigest m_MD5MessageDigest;
138
139    /**
140     *  The message digest that is used to encrypt the passwords with the SHA-1
141     *  hash algorithm.
142     */
143    private static final MessageDigest m_SHA1MessageDigest;
144
145    /**
146     *  The message digest that is used to encrypt the passwords with the SHA-1
147     *  hash algorithm.
148     */
149    private static final MessageDigest m_SHA256MessageDigest;
150
151    static
152    {
153        //---* Create the MD5 digest *-----------------------------------------
154        var algorithm = "MD5";
155        try
156        {
157            m_MD5MessageDigest = MessageDigest.getInstance( algorithm );
158        }
159        catch( final NoSuchAlgorithmException e )
160        {
161            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( format( MSG_AlgorithmNotSupported, algorithm ), e );
162        }
163
164        //---* Create the SHA digest *-----------------------------------------
165        algorithm = "SHA";
166        try
167        {
168            m_SHA1MessageDigest = MessageDigest.getInstance( algorithm );
169        }
170        catch( final NoSuchAlgorithmException e )
171        {
172            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( format( MSG_AlgorithmNotSupported, algorithm ), e );
173        }
174
175        //---* Create the SHA-256 digest *-------------------------------------
176        algorithm = "SHA-256";
177        try
178        {
179            m_SHA256MessageDigest = MessageDigest.getInstance( algorithm );
180        }
181        catch( final NoSuchAlgorithmException e )
182        {
183            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( format( MSG_AlgorithmNotSupported, algorithm ), e );
184        }
185    }
186
187        /*--------------*\
188    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
189        \*--------------*/
190    /**
191     *  No instances are allowed for this class.
192     */
193    private SecurityUtils() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( SecurityUtils.class ); }
194
195        /*---------*\
196    ====** Methods **==========================================================
197        \*---------*/
198    /**
199     *  <p>{@summary Performs the calculation for the Diffie-Hellmann-Merkle
200     *  key exchange procedure.}</p>
201     *  <p>From Wikipedia:</p> <blockquote><p>DiffieâHellman establishes a shared
202     *  secret that can be used for secret communications while exchanging data
203     *  over a public network. DiffieâHellman key exchange (D-H) is a specific
204     *  method of exchanging cryptographic keys. It is one of the earliest
205     *  practical examples of key exchange implemented within the field of
206     *  cryptography. The DiffieâHellman key exchange method allows two parties
207     *  that have no prior knowledge of each other to jointly establish a
208     *  shared secret key over an insecure communications channel. This key can
209     *  then be used to encrypt subsequent communications using a symmetric key
210     *  cipher.</p>
211     *  <p>The scheme was first published by Whitfield Diffie and Martin
212     *  Hellman in 1976, although it had been separately invented a few years
213     *  earlier within GCHQ, the British signals intelligence agency, by James
214     *  H. Ellis, Clifford Cocks and Malcolm J. Williamson but was kept
215     *  classified. In 2002, Hellman suggested the algorithm be called
216     *  DiffieâHellmanâMerkle key exchange in recognition of Ralph Merkle's
217     *  contribution to the invention of public-key cryptography (Hellman,
218     *  2002).</p>
219     *  <p>Although DiffieâHellman key agreement itself is an anonymous
220     *  (non-authenticated) key-agreement protocol, it provides the basis for a
221     *  variety of authenticated protocols, and is used to provide <i>perfect
222     *  forward secrecy</i> in Transport Layer Security's ephemeral modes
223     *  (referred to as EDH or DHE depending on the cipher
224     *  suite).</p></blockquote>
225     *  <p>This method performs the following calculation:</p>
226     *  <pre><code>K = remoteSecret<sup>localSecret</sup> mod prime</code></pre>
227     *
228     *  @param  prime   A large prime that is known to both communication
229     *      partners.
230     *  @param  localSecret The secret number that was used to create the
231     *      public value sent to the other party.
232     *  @param  remoteSecret    The public value that the other party created.
233     *  @return The encryption key <i>K</i>.
234     *
235     *  @see <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diffie%E2%80%93Hellman_key_exchange">Wikipedia: DiffieâHellman key exchange</a>
236     */
237    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
238    public static final BigInteger calculateDiffieHellmanEncryptionKey( final BigInteger prime, final BigInteger localSecret, final BigInteger remoteSecret )
239    {
240        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( remoteSecret, "remoteSecret" )
241            .modPow( requireNonNullArgument( localSecret, "localSecret" ), requireNonNullArgument( prime, "prime" ) );
242
243        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
244        return retValue;
245    }   //  calculateDiffieHellmanEncryptionKey()
246
247    /**
248     *  <p>{@summary Calculates the value that will be transmitted to the other
249     *  party on the exchange of an encryption key using the
250     *  Diffie-Hellman-Merkle key exchange scheme.}</p>>
251     *  <p>This method performs the following calculation:</p>
252     *  <pre><code>A = root<sup>random</sup> mod prime</code></pre>.
253     *
254     *  @param  prime   A large prime that is known to both communication partners.
255     *  @param  root    A primitive root <i>mod {@code prime}</i>.
256     *  @param  localSecret The secret random number.
257     *  @return The value <i>A</i> to transmit to the other party.
258     *
259     *  @see #calculateDiffieHellmanEncryptionKey(BigInteger,BigInteger,BigInteger)
260     */
261    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
262    public static final BigInteger calculateDiffieHellmanPublicValue( final BigInteger prime, final BigInteger root, final BigInteger localSecret )
263    {
264        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( root, "root" )
265            .modPow( requireNonNullArgument( localSecret, "localSecret" ), requireNonNullArgument( prime, "prime" ) );
266
267        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
268        return retValue;
269    }   //  calculateDiffieHellmanPublicValue()
270
271    /**
272     *  Calculates a checksum for the given file, based on the MD5 algorithm.
273     *
274     *  @param  file    The file.
275     *  @return The check sum.
276     *  @throws IOException Something went wrong on reading the file.
277     */
278    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
279    public static final String calculateMD5CheckSum( final File file ) throws IOException
280    {
281        requireNonNullArgument( file, "file" );
282
283        String retValue = null;
284        synchronized( m_MD5MessageDigest )
285        {
286            final var hash = determineCheckSum( file, m_MD5MessageDigest );
287            retValue = HexFormat.of().withUpperCase().formatHex( hash );
288        }
289
290        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
291        return retValue;
292    }   //  calculateMD5CheckSum()
293
294    /**
295     *  Calculates a checksum for the given file, based on the SHA-1 algorithm.
296     *
297     *  @param  file    The file.
298     *  @return The check sum.
299     *  @throws IOException Something went wrong on reading the file.
300     */
301    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
302    public static final String calculateSHACheckSum( final File file ) throws IOException
303    {
304        requireNonNullArgument( file, "file" );
305
306        String retValue = null;
307        synchronized( m_SHA1MessageDigest )
308        {
309            final var hash = determineCheckSum( file, m_SHA1MessageDigest );
310            retValue = HexFormat.of().withUpperCase().formatHex( hash );
311        }
312
313        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
314        return retValue;
315    }   //  calculateSHACheckSum()
316
317    /**
318     *  Calculates a checksum for the given file, based on the SHA-256
319     *  algorithm.
320     *
321     *  @param  file    The file.
322     *  @return The check sum.
323     *  @throws IOException Something went wrong on reading the file.
324     */
325    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.8" )
326    public static final String calculateSHA256CheckSum( final File file ) throws IOException
327    {
328        requireNonNullArgument( file, "file" );
329
330        String retValue = null;
331        synchronized( m_SHA256MessageDigest )
332        {
333            final var hash = determineCheckSum( file, m_SHA256MessageDigest );
334            retValue = HexFormat.of().withUpperCase().formatHex( hash );
335        }
336
337        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
338        return retValue;
339    }   //  calculateSHA256CheckSum()
340
341    /**
342     *  Creates a MD5 hash from the given string.<br>
343     *  <br>The output string will contain the digits from {@code 0xA} to
344     *  {@code 0xF} all as lower
345     *  case.<br>
346     *  <br>Use this method to create the values for password fields; it is
347     *  not very efficient for calculating the hash value for (large) files as
348     *  it would require to load the whole file into memory.
349     *
350     *  @param  input   The source String; may be {@code null}.
351     *  @return The String with the hash value or {@code null} if the
352     *      input parameter was already {@code null}.
353     *
354     *  @see #calculateMD5CheckSum(File)
355     */
356    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
357    public static final String calculateMD5Hash( final CharSequence input )
358    {
359        String retValue = null;
360        if( nonNull( input ) )
361        {
362            final var inputBytes = input.toString().getBytes( UTF8 );
363            retValue = HexFormat.of().withUpperCase().formatHex( calculateMD5Hash( inputBytes ) ).toLowerCase( Locale.ROOT );
364        }
365
366        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
367        return retValue;
368    }   //  calculateMD5Hash()
369
370    /**
371     *  Creates a MD5 hash from the given byte sequence.<br>
372     *  <br> This method is not very efficient for calculating the hash value
373     *  for (large) files as it would require to load the whole file into
374     *  memory.
375     *
376     *  @param  input   The byte array to hash.
377     *  @return The byte array with the hash.
378     *
379     *  @see #calculateMD5CheckSum(File)
380     */
381    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
382    public static final byte [] calculateMD5Hash( final byte [] input )
383    {
384        requireNonNullArgument( input, "input" );
385
386        byte [] retValue = null;
387        synchronized( m_MD5MessageDigest )
388        {
389            m_MD5MessageDigest.reset();
390            m_MD5MessageDigest.update( input );
391            retValue = m_MD5MessageDigest.digest();
392        }
393
394        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
395        return retValue;
396    }   //  calculateMD5Hash()
397
398    /**
399     *  Creates an SHA-1 hash from the given string.<br>
400     *  <br>The output string will contain the digits from {@code 0xA} to
401     *  {@code 0xF} all as lower
402     *  case.<br>
403     *  <br>Use this method to create the values for password fields; it is
404     *  not very efficient for calculating the hash value for (large) files as
405     *  it would require to load the whole file into memory.
406     *
407     *  @param  input   The source String; may be {@code null}.
408     *  @return The String with the hash value or {@code null} if the
409     *      input parameter was already {@code null}.
410     *
411     *  @see #calculateSHACheckSum(File)
412     */
413    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
414    public static final String calculateSHA1Hash( final CharSequence input )
415    {
416        String retValue = null;
417        if( nonNull( input ) )
418        {
419            final var inputBytes = input.toString().getBytes( UTF8 );
420            retValue = HexFormat.of().withLowerCase().formatHex( calculateSHA1Hash( inputBytes ) );
421        }
422
423        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
424        return retValue;
425    }   //  calculateSHA1Hash()
426
427    /**
428     *  Creates an SHA-1 hash from the given byte sequence.<br>
429     *  <br> This method is not very efficient for calculating the hash value
430     *  for (large) files as it would require to load the whole file into
431     *  memory.
432     *
433     *  @param  input   The byte array to hash.
434     *  @return The byte array with the hash.
435     *
436     *  @see #calculateSHACheckSum(File)
437     */
438    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
439    public static final byte [] calculateSHA1Hash( final byte [] input )
440    {
441        requireNonNullArgument( input, "input" );
442
443        byte [] retValue = null;
444        synchronized( m_SHA1MessageDigest )
445        {
446            m_SHA1MessageDigest.reset();
447            m_SHA1MessageDigest.update( input );
448            retValue = m_SHA1MessageDigest.digest();
449        }
450
451        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
452        return retValue;
453    }   //  calculateSHA1Hash()
454
455    /**
456     *  Creates an SHA-256 hash from the given string.<br>
457     *  <br>The output string will contain the digits from {@code 0xA} to
458     *  {@code 0xF} all as lower
459     *  case.<br>
460     *  <br>Use this method to create the values for password fields; it is
461     *  not very efficient for calculating the hash value for (large) files as
462     *  it would require to load the whole file into memory.
463     *
464     *  @param  input   The source String; may be {@code null}.
465     *  @return The String with the hash value or {@code null} if the
466     *      input parameter was already {@code null}.
467     *
468     *  @see #calculateSHA256CheckSum(File)
469     */
470    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.8" )
471    public static final String calculateSHA256Hash( final CharSequence input )
472    {
473        String retValue = null;
474        if( nonNull( input ) )
475        {
476            final var inputBytes = input.toString().getBytes( UTF8 );
477            retValue = HexFormat.of().withLowerCase().formatHex( calculateSHA256Hash( inputBytes ) );
478        }
479
480        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
481        return retValue;
482    }   //  calculateSHA256Hash()
483
484    /**
485     *  Creates an SHA-256 hash from the given byte sequence.<br>
486     *  <br> This method is not very efficient for calculating the hash value
487     *  for (large) files as it would require to load the whole file into
488     *  memory.
489     *
490     *  @param  input   The byte array to hash.
491     *  @return The byte array with the hash.
492     *
493     *  @see #calculateSHA256CheckSum(File)
494     */
495    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.8" )
496    public static final byte [] calculateSHA256Hash( final byte [] input )
497    {
498        requireNonNullArgument( input, "input" );
499
500        byte [] retValue = null;
501        synchronized( m_SHA256MessageDigest )
502        {
503            m_SHA256MessageDigest.reset();
504            m_SHA256MessageDigest.update( input );
505            retValue = m_SHA256MessageDigest.digest();
506        }
507
508        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
509        return retValue;
510    }   //  calculateSHA256Hash()
511}
512//  class SecurityUtils()
